channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report E-2024080771
item.description:
Report E-2024080771

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-04T09:14:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-28
  • City: ARCOLA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) quart of material released from two (2) 1-quart metal cans due to improper loading of the freight. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerized the spent absorbents, the damaged cans and impacted packaging into one (1) 6-gallon metal pail. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2024082022

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-17
  • City: BEDFORD PARK
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UNLOADER DISCOVERED LEAKING PACKAGE INSIDE TRAILER AS HE WAS UNLOADING WALLS. STOPPED, TOLD A SUPERVISOR, SUPERVISOR CALLED FOR RESPONDER. RESPONDER FOLLOWED STEP. UPON OPENING PACKGE, RESPONDER DISCOVERED PACKAGE WAS A LEAKING HAZMAT. RESPONDER CONTACTED RMP, RMP INITIATED CONTACTING CHAIN OF COMMAND. OUTSIDE RESPONDER TOOK PACKAGE WITH THEM.

item.title: Report I-2024080074
item.description:
Report I-2024080074

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-17
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: THE KANSAS CITY SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0925hrs on July 17, 2024, Canadian Pacific Kansas City (CPKC) Railroad's Hazmat Department received notice of a possible hazmat leak in its East St. Louis Yard. Hazmat mobilized a railroad qualified response contractor to investigate and mitigate the release. Upon arrival, responders identified PROX 32954 (residue ANHYDROUS AMMONIA car) as the source of the leak. The vapor valve was found slightly opened, and the vapor valve's secondary closure plug was less than tool tight. Responders closed the valve and secured the plug. Air monitoring confirmed the leak to be mitigated. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best Information available at the time of filing. This shipment was offered as a 'bulk' shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package is not known to the carrier. This carrier does not have access to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.
